intro: Byttneria scalpellata f. glabra, commonly known as the smooth byttneria, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
